rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all video game compilations. These are the sets of games bundled as a unit.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Video Game Compilation

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a videogame compilation to an individual game that is included in the compilation.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Games Included

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type containing standard descriptors for potentially offensive content in a video game, e.g. "animated blood", "alcohol reference", and "strong sexual content".
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Video Game Content Descriptor

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that links a standard descriptor of potentially offensive content to a video game rating system that uses this descriptor.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Rating System
versions_with_this_descriptor
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: This property is not properly defined. Given the name, it should relate a content descriptor to a version of a game rather than to an evaluation of a game. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all video game distribution systems. This is the system by which video game content is distributed to consumers.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Video Game Distribution System

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a video game distribution system to a game version that is available through this system.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Games Distributed

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a video game distribution system to a currency that can be used to pay for games available through the system.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Payment System

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a video game distribution system to a platform, e.g. Xbox, for which the system provides games.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Platforms Supported

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of video game engines. This is the software framework designed to help create and develop video games.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Video Game Engine

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a computer game engine to the organization or a person who developed the game engine.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Developer

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a video game engine to the family of engines that it belongs to.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Engine Family

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a video game engine to an earlier engine that it is based on or evolved from.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Predecessor Engine

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a video game engine to a later engine that is based on it or evolved from it.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Successor Engine

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that links a video game engine to a video game that was developed using the engine.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Used for Video Games

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all video game engine developers. These are agents responsible for creating, maintaining, and releasing the software engines that power computer games.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Video Game Engine Developer

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type that contains families of video game engines, e.g. the Quake Engine, which is the basis for the various engines used to develop the Quake video games.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Video Game Engine Family

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a family of video game engines to an engine in this family.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Engines in the Family
Video Game Evaluation
rdf:Description.mso:type.type.deprecation_info: This relationship type and its properties duplicate the type cvg.computer_game_rating and its properties. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles] Successor:[mso:cvg.computer_game_rating]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The type of content found during this evaluation
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Content descriptors

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The general, age-related rating
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Rating

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: When the game received this evaluation
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Release rated

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all video game expansions. These are the additions published as either stand-alone games or extensions for other games.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Video Game Expansion

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a videogame expansion pack to the original game of which it is an expansion.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Expansion

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A Boolean property that indicates whether or not the expansion pack can be played independently of the original game.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Standalone

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type containing videogames that are alterations of existing, unmodded games. Note that a video game mod is not a stand-alone game; it requires the original game to be played.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Video Game Mod

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that links a videogame mod to the original game that it is based on.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Game Modified

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of performance types in computer and video games.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Video Game Performance Type

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all video game ratings. These are the ratings that determine the age range for a given game.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Video Game Rating

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The suggested age (in years) of consumption specified by the rating board
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Age range
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: Use ratings.rating.minimum_age and ratings.rating.maximum_age instead. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles] Successor:[mso:ratings.rating.minimum_age]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a rating of a video game to a standard content descriptor that is associated with the rating.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Content Descriptor

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that specifies information about the video game rating system used.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Rating System

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that specifies the video game versions that have the given rating. Note that the expected type of this property needs to be changed to cvg.game_version.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Versions with the Rating
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: The expected type of this property has been deprecated. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all video game rating systems. These are the systems designed to rate video games, to indicate age appropriate game play.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Video Game Rating System

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a videogame rating system to a standard descriptor for potentially offensive content used by the rating system, e.g. "animated blood", "alcohol reference", and "strong sexual content".
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Content Descriptors

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a videogame rating system to a rating associated with the system.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Ratings

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Enter games that deal with this subject. Individual games in a series should be entered individually.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Games On This Subject

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description:
This type includes video games and hand-held electronic games. It encompasses all computerized games, incorporating platforms from computer to console, from game arcade to mobile device. It represents a more general concept than mso:cvg.game_version which corresponds to a particular version of a video game.
Things that are video games:
## All video games regardless of platform, such as games for computers, consoles, arcades, and cellphones.
## Computer game expansions and expansion packs such as The Sims: House Party and Half-Life: Blue Shift.
## Computer game remakes such as Metal Gear Solid: The Twin Snakes. In this case, the type mso:media_common.adaptation should also be used.
## Internet game applications such as Farmville.
## Video game compilations such as Sonic Jam.
## Video game modifications such as Multi Theft Auto.
## Audio games such as Real Sound: Kaze no Regret.
## Hand-held electronic games such as Mattel Auto Race.
Things that are NOT video games:
## Video game series such as Call of Duty and Grand Theft Auto. In this case, use mso:cvg.game_series.
## Video game versions such as Tekken 6 for PS3. Use mso:cvg.game_version for these.
## Pinball games such as The Addams Family.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Video Game
Jeu vid??o

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a computer videogame to an action of purchasing a copy of the videogame.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Buy Videogame

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that links a videogame to information about the characters that appear in the videogame, e.g. the voice actor who plays the character.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Characters

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a video game to a modification pack (usually user-created) for the game.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Mods

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a computer videogame to a computer game rating for the game.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Computer Game Rating

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a videogame to an organization or person responsible for the high-level design of the game.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Designers

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The organization or person who is responsible for creating the original version of the videogame.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Developer

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that links a videogame to an expansion pack for the videogame.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Expansions

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a videogame to the series of which it is a part.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Game Series

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a videogame to a standard descriptor about how the game can be played: single player, cooperative multiplayer, competitive multiplayer, etc
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Gameplay Modes

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a videogame to a standard descriptor regarding a dominant theme of the game, e.g. wargame or flight simulator.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Genre

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a videogame to another game which it has influenced.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Influenced

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that links a videogame to another videogame that has influenced it.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Influenced by

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a videogame to a review of the game. Note that the expected type of this property should be changed to ratings.review.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Reviews

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a videogame to a class of peripherals that are supported by the game, e.g. guitar controller.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Peripheral Classes Supported

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a videogame to a specific peripheral that is supported by the game.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Peripherals Supported

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a computer videogame to all of the platforms, e.g. Super Nintendo Entertainment System, than can play the videogame.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Platforms

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that links a videogame to one of the videogames that precede it in the given game series.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Prequel

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a videogame to a specification of the kind of processor that is required to play the game.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Processors Supported

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a videogame to the company that is responsible for manufacturing and marketing the original version of the videogame.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Publisher

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The earliest date of release of any version in any region.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Initial release date

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a videogame to one of the videogames that follow it in the given game series.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Sequel

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a videogame to an album containing music from the video game.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Soundtracks

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a videogame to a standard descriptor regarding a dominant theme of the game. Note that a subgenre of a videogame should be more specific than any of the genres that are applied to the game.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Subgenre

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a videogame to the game engine with which it was developed.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Game Engine

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a videogame to a version of the videogame.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Versions

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A relationship type that stores information about the settings of a crosshair display for a first-person shooter computer/video game.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Crosshair Settings

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that indicates the relative brightness with which the crosshair should be displayed in the given computer/video game.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Alpha

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that indicates the color with which the crosshair should be rendered in the given computer/video game.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Color

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A Boolean property that indicates that a dot should be displayed in the center of a crosshair in the given computer/video game.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Dot

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the first-person shooter computer/video game for which the crosshair settings are given.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Game

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the relative size of the space in the center of a crosshair in a given computer/video game.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Gap

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that indicates the relative boldness of the borders of a crosshair in a given computer/video game.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Outline

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the relative size of the crosshair in the given computer/video game.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Size

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies a standard descriptor for the look of a crosshair in a computer/video game, e.g. default, classic or dynamic.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Style

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the relative height/width of the components of a crosshair in a given computer/video game.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Thickness

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all video game designers. These are the agents that design the game play, the conceiving and designing the rules and structure of a game.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Video Game Designer

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all video game developers, those agents responsible for the process of creating video games.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Video Game Developer

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all video game characters. These are the fictional characters appearing in video games.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Video Game Character

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that links a character in a videogame to information about the character's performance in the game.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Games

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type that collects information about a voice actor's portrayal of a character in a videogame.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Video Game Performance

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the type of performance of the given actor, e.g. voice acting, likeness.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Performance Role

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the videogame of the performance.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Game

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the character portrayed by the given actor in the performance.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Character

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A Boolean property that indicates that this is the first appearance of the given character.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Game Character Debut

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the actor/actress who is responsible for the performance.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Actor

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A Boolean property that indicates whether or not a player can control the given character.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Playable

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all video game series. These are the video game franchises featuring a similar story line, same characters, or other commonalities that tie the games together.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Video Game Series

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property relating a series of videogames to one of the games in the series.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Game in Series

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A video game version is an edition of a video game, published by a particular company for a particular platform and released in a particular region. The publishers and/or developers of different versions of a game may differ. Note that this type is different from mso:cvg.computer_videogame, which represents the generalized concept of a game across its various editions. For instance, there is only one video game ???The Sims 2???, but there are many versions of this game for different platforms (e.g. The Sims 2 for Microsoft Windows, The Sims 2 for PSP, The Sims 2 for Xbox, etc.).
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Video Game Version

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The region(s) in which this version was released
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Regions

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a version of a videogame to the original videogame.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Game

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: An organization or person who is responsible for porting the original videogame to the platform that is specific to this version.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Developer

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that links a videogame version to the system by which the version is distributed to consumers.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Distribution System

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a videogame version to a class of peripherals that are supported by the version, e.g. guitar controller.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Peripheral Classes Supported

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a videogame version to a specific peripheral that is supported by the version, e.g. WiiMote or EyeToy.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Peripherals supported

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a videogame version to the platform, e.g. Super Nintendo Entertainment System, than can play the videogame version.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Platform

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The organization that is responsible for manufacturing and marketing the specific version of the videogame.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Publisher

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that links a version of a videogame to information about the rating associated with the videogame. Note that the expected type of this property should be changed to cvg.computer_game_rating.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Rating

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The platform-specific or region-specific release date.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Release Date

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: [ This property is deprecated. Please use the entity name instead ]
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Version-specific name

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all video game actors. These are the people that lend some performance to a given video game.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Video Game Actor

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that links a voice actor who appears in a videogame with information about his or her performance in the videogame.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Computer Game Voice Performance

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all game play modes. These are the settings to modify the game. Examples include 'single player' and 'survival' modes.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Gameplay Mode

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all video game genres. These are the groupings of video games that categorize games with similar themes.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Video Game Genre

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type that is used to store computer/console settings that are modified in the context of a particular game.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: In-game Qualification

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the computer/video game in question.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Game

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the screen resolution in the context of the given computer/video game.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Screen Resolution

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the unit of the modified value in the context of the given computer/video game.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Unit

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the modified value of the setting in the context of the given computer/video game.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Value

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all video game input methods. These are the devices or means by which the player interacts with the game.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Input Method

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A relationship type that stores information about the settings of a computer mouse by a player for computer/video games.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Mouse Settings

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the number of centimeters required to turn one's character in a first-person computer/video game.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: 360 Centimeters

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the number of inches required to turn one's character in a first-person computer/video game.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: 360 Inches

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the number of pixels that the cursor will move for every inch that the mouse is moved.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Dots per Inch

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the result of multiplying the value of the property mso:cvg.mouse_settings.dots_per_inch by the value of the following path: mso:cvg.mouse_settings.in_game_sensitivity -> mso:cvg.in_game_qualification.value.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Effective Dots per Inch

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies how fast one can turn one's character in a given first-person game. Note that the values for this property are not comparable from one game to another.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: In-game Sensitivity

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the mouse to which the settings apply.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Mouse

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the mousepad used with the given mouse.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Mousepad

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the number of times per second that the processor queries the mouse.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Polling Rate

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A Boolean property that indicates that the potential effects of the operating system on mouse settings are disabled.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Raw Input

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the number of mouse counts that will move the cursor one pixel on the screen. At a setting of 6/11, each mouse count will move the cursor one pixel, a ratio of 1:1.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Windows Sensitivity

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Any videogame whose dominant theme is music, either as an accompaniment to dance or as a means of learning to play (parts of) famous songs.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Musical Game

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: [Deprecated] The devices which can be used to control this game. Please use the \"Peripherals supported\" and \"Peripheral classes supported\" properties of Computer Game and Computer Game version instead.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Input Method

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that links a videogame to information about a song that is part of the videogame. Note that the expected type of this property should be changed to cvg.musical_game_song.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Songs

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all musical game songs. These are the songs that play a larger role than just background music, but are a significant component of the game play.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Musical Game Song

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that links a song used in a musical videogame with the game where the song is used. Note that the expected type of this property should be changed to cvg.computer_videogame.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Games
Musical game/song relationship
rdf:Description.mso:type.type.deprecation_info: This relationship type is not needed. The properties pointing to this type should be modified so that they point to either music_game_song or musical_game. All of the properties on this relationship type are direct attributes of either the videogame or the song. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Is this song availalble for download?
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Download?

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The game for which this song is availble on these platforms.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Game
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: Use cvg.musical_game.songs (once the expected type has been changed to music.track). DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles] Successor:[mso:cvg.musical_game.songs]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A song that can be played in this game and on these platforms.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Song
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: Use cvg.musical_game.songs (once the expected type has been changed to cvg.musical_game_song). DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles] Successor:[mso:cvg.musical_game.songs]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The platform(s) this song can be played on with this game.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Platforms

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The date this track was made available for this game.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Release date

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all video game platforms. This is the hardware device that, along with the game software, enables game play.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Video Game Platform

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a videogame platform to the videogames that can be played on the platform.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Games

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a videogame platform to the videogame *versions* that can be played on the platform.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Game Versions

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a computer videogame platform to a service, e.g. Netflix or Xbox Live, that the platform is able to access and use.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Service

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all video game publishers. These are the businesses that publish video games.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Video Game Publisher

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a videogame publisher to a *version* of a videogame that the entity has published.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Game Versions

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a videogame publisher to a videogame that the entity has published.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Games

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all video game soundtracks. These are the albums of songs produced to accompany video game play.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Video Game Soundtrack
